meanings.definition: To betray someone's trust or loyalty by secretly harming them.
meanings.sent1: She backstabbed her friend by spreading rumors behind her back.
meanings.sent2: He felt hurt when he found out he was backstabbed by his colleague.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox backstabbed the rabbit by stealing its carrots.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain backstabbed our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The villain backstabbed the hero just when he thought they were allies.

meanings.definition: The act of betraying someone by attacking them from behind.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's backstabbed left him wounded and vulnerable.
meanings.sent2: The ultimate betrayal in the movie was the backstabbed by the trusted advisor.
meanings.sent3: The backstabbed in the game caught everyone off guard and changed the outcome.
meanings.sent4: The backstabbed in the play symbolized the character's descent into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The backstabbed at the negotiation table shattered any hope for peace.
